Title: Principal Technologist, EMEA
RoleDescription:
MongoDBs mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhereon premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, its no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
Position Summary
We're seeking an exceptional Principal Technologist to join our team as a Field CTO. In this pivotal role, you will drive mindshare and MongoDB adoption with our most strategic customers. You'll engage senior technical leaders and drive thought leadership to position MongoDB as the premier solution for AI and modern applications, meeting the rigorous security, durability, availability, and performance demands of the most sophisticated organizations.
This role can be based out of our Dublin office or remotely in the EMEA region.
Key Responsibilities

Engage and influence executives and technical decision-makers at Fortune 1000 companies, championing MongoDB's value and capabilities
Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, and our Strategic Developer Relations team to develop and deliver high-impact technical engagements and targeted educational sessions to build mindshare with our most strategic accounts
Develop and maintain deep expertise in MongoDB products, industry trends, and the competitive landscape
Act as the voice of the customer, gathering feedback and sentiment to influence our product roadmap
Drive thought leadership and build mindshare for MongoDB by creating content (e.g. blog posts, whitepapers, video content, etc) and engaging publicly through speaking events, press, and analyst relations

Qualifications

10+ years of senior-level experience in roles such as Developer Advocacy, Solutions Consulting, or Enterprise Architecture
A recognized technical leader with deep, hands-on experience architecting and implementing enterprise-scale solutions
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
Deep understanding of distributed systems, cloud computing, enterprise architecture, and the key drivers of enterprise technology decisions
Proficiency in at least one popular programming language or development framework and familiarity with modern application architectures

Additional Requirements

Proven ability to influence audiences through both direct, in-person engagement and scalable, published content
Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time; a strong public profile and online presence can complement travel requirements
Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically about the intersection of technology innovation and business value
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build and nurture relationships with C-level executives and senior technical decision-makers

Use software architecture and coding patterns to reduce the impact of security issues
Be security subject matter experts for our tech stack and products

Partner closely with engineering teams to design and implement security controls across our software and systems
Research and POC new attacks against our systems.  Plan and perform product security assessments including architecture review threat modeling, code review, pen testing and general security consulting to proactively build security controls
Serve as a security subject matter expert for software security and architecture
Partner with cloud detection and response to create new capabilities or respond to security events
Educate the engineering org on security through CTFs, lunch-and-learns, and one-on-one mentorship

7 years of experience in application security, software security, or product security
Demonstrated expertise in C++ programming to thoroughly assess existing codebases for security vulnerabilities and develop or support remediations and enhancements including mitigating memory-related security flaws such as buffer overflows and memory leaks
Deep subject matter expertise in database security, application security, software security, or data security
Deep knowledge database engines,database internals and applied cryptography
Demonstrated ability to identify and fix security issues through manual code review, application penetration testing, or red teaming
Scripting experience and ability to contribute code back to our environments
Comfortable leading threat modeling and being a security ambassador to other engineering teams
Communicate complex technical issues in a simple manner that builds trust with a variety of audiences
A strong sense of ownership and delivery
Can facilitate a conversation rather than dominate it
Skilled at providing collaborative, actionable feedback, not just a list of flaws

We have a diverse, inclusive, equitable, and high-performing environment at MongoDB and want to continuously improve our ability to deliver for customers.
Nice to Haves

Working knowledge of one or more major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Experience with large scale environments

Success in this role means

Taking ownership of one or more security programs such as appsec, cloud, or detect/response
Seeing projects through from conception to completion in order to deliver new services or capabilities for the team
Establishing yourself as a go-to person for discussing security topics

Title: Lead Engineer, Server Programmability
RoleDescription:
MongoDBs mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhereon premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, its no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
Join and lead MongoDBs Server Programmability team, helping build the core of a distributed database! Server Programmabilitys responsibilities include, but are not limited to, improving local server development experience and velocity, enhancing the programming model, and building low level reusable software components that can be leveraged by other teams working on the database.
Our team currently consists of six engineers, located both in New York City and fully remote. We operate close to the bottom of the stack, and have a lot of influence over the performance and robustness of our open source database as well as the development efficiency of the engineering team overall. Recently, weve built tooling to help support better modularization of the server codebase, migrated server unit testing to a well supported open-source framework, and are currently evaluating the feasibility of introducing coroutines to the Server codebase.
Our team champions a strong culture of inclusivity, diversity, and collaboration. If you want to work on a collaborative team that applies great engineering fundamentals to deliver the foundational components of a popular database, join us! Lets change whats possible for application developers, system architects, and database operators everywhere.
Note: This role can be based out of our NYC office or remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Youre an ideal candidate if:

You have 2 or more years of experience managing a team of software engineers
You have strong technical judgment that you use to effectively guide engineering decisions
You have first-hand experience developing complex systems in C++ (like databases, distributed systems, or high-performance applications) and you use this context to understand the challenges your team faces
You enjoy coaching, career development, and creating growth opportunities to help your team reach their full potential
You care about building a diverse, inclusive environment where engineers can do their best work
You put the customer first and don't hesitate to cross team boundaries in search of the right solution

As a Lead Engineer, Server Programmability you will:

Lead a team of 5-8 engineers, managing all aspects of people management including hiring, growth, compensation, and performance management
Be directly responsible for the results your team delivers
Own the definition and execution of the teams 12-month roadmap
Drive improvements to processes and tools especially those that allow us to confidently make changes to high risk parts of our codebase
Use data to inform decisions and measure the impact of work the team ships
Guide the team through making complex changes that balance performance against other requirements
Handle (or lead the effort to handle) time-sensitive customer escalations
Collaborate with stakeholders and engineering teams across the company to jointly work on large initiatives
Work with product managers, program managers, and other teams to specify, prioritize and deliver new features that delight our users
Ensure high quality and velocity in the design and implementation of new functionality in MongoDB server

Success Measures
In the first month:

You have understood the high level architecture of the server and the team's responsibilities
You are starting to develop relationships with key stakeholders
You have gained familiarity with the required day-to-day processes to manage the team

In three months:

You have taken over management of your team, and are starting to build trust with your reports
You have assumed responsibility for the day-to-day processes necessary to keep the lights on
You are involved in reviewing the design for new features and helping the team navigate technical challenges

In six months:

You have established your role as a leader in the organization such that team members naturally go to you for guidance
You are beginning to involve yourself in planning and roadmapping efforts
You are leading the planning and execution of a new major feature

In twelve months:

You have performed a full annual cycle of performance and growth conversations with your team members
You have contributed to the vision for the future of the Server Programmability team and helped develop a plan to achieve that vision
You have increased the capability and velocity of your team in measurable ways

Beyond the normal tasks of a MongoDB Solutions Architect, this specialist role will operate in a worldwide team, assist in the most complex deal cycles, assist in enablement, and work closely with the product team to close the feedback loop and further enhance the product moving forward. 
Atlas Stream Processing (ASP) is a MongoDB-native way to process streaming data, transforming the way developers build modern applications. With ASP, developers use the MongoDB aggregation framework to process the rich and complex data found in streaming platforms such as Apache Kafka. This unlocks new, powerful ways to continuously process streaming data (e.g., aggregate, filter, route, alert, and emit) and materialize results into Atlas or back into the streaming platform for consumption by other systems. Atlas Stream Processing makes stream processing a native capability of Atlas, enabling developers to unify all of the data required to power their applications.
ASP is ideal for industries that have large and diverse real-time data processing requirements, as are often found within the network security, fintech, IoT, manufacturing, oil and gas, and aerospace industries. Examples of great-fit use cases include using streaming data to power applications ranging from fraud/anomaly detection, systems monitoring, algorithmic trading, predictive maintenance, device telemetry, click-stream analysis, real-time recommendation engines, and more. Specifically, ideal use cases for ASP are where developers need to build applications that react to data in near real-time and want to use MQL and the document model.
